subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Business Plan Myth
description: One-minute skill: The Business Plan Myth.

hook.text: For decades, every MBA student learned the same lesson: write a detailed business plan before starting.

buildup.text: Plans projected revenue five years out, with hockey-stick growth charts that impressed investors.

discovery.text: Steve Blank discovered that no business plan survives first contact with customers. Not one.

twist.text: Plans assume you know the customer, the problem, and the solution. Startups know none of these.

climax.text: Blank replaced the business plan with the Business Model Canvasâ€”a single page of testable hypotheses.

punchline.text: A plan is a guess. A hypothesis is a guess you can test.

quiz.question: What did Steve Blank propose as a replacement for the traditional business plan?
